comment: He's all over the place. Grading is ok. Easy "B".

Prof. Gilliam is like a diamond in the rough. If you get to know him, you realize that he has a soft personality. He uses no power points, so the book is used a lot. I like this because it makes lectures more like conversations. I recommend reading the book before class and also bringing the book to class along with notes and questions.

Heres a warning. Only take if you are going to come to class, be freindly, and laugh at his sometimes funny jokes. Now, tests can be tough but not too bad if you practice the concepts. Don't expect grades on D2l. Gives extra credit basically. Group quizs/take home quizs/ curves tests.

Here sits a hilarious professor with serious tenure at the University and doesn't care what you think. He's awesome. Pay attention and participate in class, even laugh at some of his jokes, and you'll get a good grade. (Most of the jokes are making fun of people). He doesn't post grades till the end, so if you have anxiety, stay away. I loved it.

Gilliam's lectures hardly help you pass his class. The only way to ensure a good grade is to read the book. Gilliam takes attendance on occasion, typically when there are few people in class. If you go to class everyday, he will recognize you and learn your name, and factor that heavily into your grade at the end of the semester. I recommend him.

Not a good professor, gives no way for you to be able to follow his teaching style, just simply ears out the book and expects you to understand everything perfectly. Doesn't show you any of your grades  until they're posted in owl express. Just avoid this professor.

Second class with this professor and he really grew on me, so much that I'm waiting to take a class so I can get him. I'll be honestly, math is not my strong point and this class was difficult for me. I built a respectful relationship with this professor and it made the difference between a B and a C.

Here's the deal with Gilliam. The man is above this class. It doesn't interest him. If you read the book, you will pass. The man truly appreciates respect from his students, class participation will make a difference in a letter grade when it comes down to the wire. I took him a second time, your personalities just need to mesh.

Laid back and non-chalant in class. He has had a high ranked private school background; I believe this leads to him wanting KSU students would study outside of class. I had not studied rigorously for a class until his class. I got an "A", while it was not easy, I learned a valuable lesson. Read the book to get an " A" or "B". Nice guy out of class.

Tests are heavily curved  mostly taught myself the material (textbook is a must)  HE'S a nice guy but definitely not your average teacher  lectures are confusing and slow  still ended up learning a lot from the class due to his laid back teaching style.

Lectures are confusing, he talks in circles and mumbles a lot. He's an entertaining guy (made the class laugh a lot) but I just didn't learn much from his teaching style.. His random pop quizzes are only a means of taking attendance so go to every single class. Take if you like a challenge. Econ just doesn't interest me enough to be so dedicated.
this guy is absolutely hilarious. the class and tests are very tough but he'll curve some tests or give the option for a retake. dont expect an A but a B is very doable

Not a bad man or a mean man, but the only way you can really pass is by reading every chapter for each test. He isn't clear about everything in class and is sometimes very confusing on what he is talking about. He does curve most of the tests, which helps, but it is a little confusing.

Doesn't put any grades on D2L. Comes into class and just reads out of the book, very unclear about EVERYTHING. The only good thing is that he gives you study guides for tests. He curves everything and will just bump your grades up if he likes you.  He just doesn't care anymore so its kind of a easy grade but you won't actually learn anything.

This guy is hilarious, and reminds you of the grandpa from the Tyler Perry movies. His tests are no joke though, and because you only have 3 of them and they count 60% of your grade, you better be in class and study. No homework taken up, thank God, one problem set worth 15%, no midterm, final is comprehensive, study! Overall, cool, tough teacher.

This class requires you to learn on your own and ask the professor for clarification. He is really helpful and breaks down the text to simplicity.  The class requires a lot if time to get the nuances which will make the differences in passing.

The professor does not give any cushion for you to pass if you don't pass the test . There are three test before the final and they are worth 60% and the final is worth 25%. You'll have two practice packets worth 15% & after 3 absences your grade drops a letter.

This guy is very intelligent about the subject he teaches although other matters not so much. He is great,go to class pay attention and if you don't understand something go to his office he thinks a lot of students seeking help. Also keep in mind he is tenure so he does whatever he wants grading wise so even if at first it doesn't lookgood finish!

I actually had a very pleasant experience with this professor. I took him this summer at 8AM on Saturday.  We were simply graded off effort, helpfulness in class and attendance. I can't say Fall or Spring semesters would be this way, but he was VERY easy in the summer. On the day of the Final he took us all to  Cracker Barrel! Great Professor!!

Listen, Professor Gilliam is "old school". He teaches the class but expects you to actually participate/put some effort into the class! Get over any entitlement issues you have. Whatever you put into the class is what you're going to get out of the class! I busted my hump and ended up with a "B". Make the effort and you will do just fine...

i just finished the first week with this joker. He literally reads down one-page notes, explaining with a mumbled sentence, usually ending with "and yeah.." had to be corrected by a student who had the book on the inflation formula! I don't pay 8 grand a year for someone who doesn't prepare to teach, i didn't have a choice, look for another prof.

This was one of the worst classes that I've ever taken.  He does not use any sort of PowerPoint, and just lectures from his notepad while he mumbles.  You do not see your grade in the class until the very end.
DO NOT TAKE THIS PROFESSOR! You will not learn a thing and will probably have to take the class over again. AVOID THIS PROFESSOR AT ALL COSTS!

Worst teacher I have ever had. You do not see any grades until your final grade. He gives back tests with a number on them but refuses to tell you what it is out of, says he has not decided.. He is mean, confusing, and cannot teach.

I got an A, but I went to class every day and sat in the very front.  That is the only way to do it. Google the problem set questions and you will find most of them.  You will need to spend at least 12 hours a week practicing problems. He loves to mess with your head on the tests.  If you go to his office hours he is very helpful.

He isn't a very good teacher. Mumbles the information a lot and just stands at his desk most the time and reads his notes. He expects you to know it all on your own pretty much. On the bright side, he curves like crazy and let us do all of our quizzes in groups. For that reason I will probably end up with an A.

Listen to me. I am a Finance major taking and receiving A's 4000 level math based courses and ended up having to take ECON 2300 with this man because it wasn't a required class from where I transferred. I would be getting a C or failing if it were not for his enormous curves. Very scatterbrained and unclear in class. Makes easy concepts HARD. AVOID
Don't even think about taking him. I promise he is the worst teacher you will ever take. If this is your only option, then wait till next semester. You wont regret it.
3 tests, 2 take home and correct, pop quizzes. I had no idea what grades I got in the class the whole time until I saw my letter grade on my transcript. I didn't learn anything from this teacher.

Do not take this class with this professor. He does not explain how to do problems, just writes them on the board assuming we know what he is doing as he goes along. If you ask a question, he most of the time shoots back with sarcasm or points out that we should already know it and never answers your question. He doesn't help you at all!

Worst possible prof, this guy could write a book on doing the bare minimum as a teacher.  We ended up taking 3 tests of which one was dropped and the other two were sent home for a home redo.  Do not take this prof, he will play games with your head and have you in the dark about what your grade is.

Shouldve dropped when I had the chance. He'll sit at the desk just mumbling notes off a piece of paper rather than writing all the math he is saying. Refuses and dodges every chance to give back your grades. I have taken three exams and some quizes and have no idea what grade I have in the class. Funny guy though.

His lectures are too vague, his tests are much more difficult than anything he gives you in advance, and the class overall is one of the worst I've had so far. Avoid at all costs, even if it means switching schools.

Attendance is mandatory and with good reason! Econ is a tough class. He seems rude in class but if you seek help outside of class he is super nice. He gives you a good grade if you show that you're trying and ask questions. If you ask stupid questions about something he ALREADY WENT OVER, obviously he's going to give you a stupid answer.
Funny professor, but didn't have a very clear teaching style. Tests were pretty difficult.

I also like Professor Gillian if you come to class and do the work there isn't any reason you shouldn't pass with A or B. It is not an easy class but he won't just fail you if you are really trying and you seek help from him.
I personally really like Professor Gilliam. If you come to class, study for the tests you will get an A.  In addition the tests are always curved.

Was very scattered topics in class. Lots of assignments and not graded. I totally dont understand how to work those probability, hypothesis testing, etc stuff and got a C. I feel lucky, thought I had failed. If you show interest in the class and he knows your name, cannot fail. Not that great a teacher, but overall passed!
Class lectures are scattered but they often end early. Tests are straight from the book and he curves them a lot. Fairly easy A if you study the study guides and the book.

HORRIBLE PROFESSOR! Slept in class, rarely talked about economics, openly mocked students. Not helpful, didn't grade anything, even multiple choice take home tests. 60 question final (that wasn't graded) = WASTE! Got an A, but don't know how. Had to study HARD for high school EOCT. AVOID AT ALL COSTS! STRESS NOT EVEN WORTH THE FREE A.

I had to take an EOCT at my high-school and I still do not understand half of what he "lectured" in class. He spent most classes either sleeping during movies or talking about topics that had nothing to do with the course (Free food on campus, HOPE changes, and ipads). Avoid at all costs unless you like teaching yourself material.

Unless you plan on teaching yourself the entire course, I would recommend avoiding this class if you could. The exams are not structured like a general ed course but like a grad class. He does curve the tests almost 30 points, but the majority of the class STILL got a C. If that doesn't raise a red flag, I don't know what does.

Terrible professor. Very sarcastic and rude. He doesn't teach, the only way I got an A was from reading the book multiple times. The one good side is that he curves most of the four exams. Overall I would say avoid him if possibe.

Professor Gilliam is hilarious. He is also very smart and pays attention to the class so don't goof off. He seems very intimidating in class but if you get a chance to talk to him outside of class you'll find that he is a very nice man. If he sees that you are trying hard your grades will reflect it. Whatever you do just don't ask stupid question.
Hes a funny guy, however, to do well in his class you really have to apply yourself. His examples are not too clear and he thinks a lot of the problems are common sense and apparently you should to!

I really do not understand what all the people are complaining about. compared to what i am used to this class was pretty easy. 3 exams with about 5 formulas to remember for each. + very funny guy, all the stuff about people he makes fun of is true but you should have been there. these people really asked dumb questions and shouldnt be in college
Terrible. Forgets that we take this class as a core.

This guy is the most annoying, unhelpful professor you can find.  He doesn't use powerpoint: he teaches by drawing graphs which he is terrible at explaining.  He constantly makes fun of students and cracks himself up with jokes that nobody else gets.  Avoid at all costs.

He is knowledgeable about business statistics but that is about it. He doesn't seem to give a damn about helping out. He is an awful teacher. Half the questions on the tests are not on the study guides.

He is simply aweful! He is rude, rushes through concepts, and does not care if you understand him or not.  I wouldn't take him again even if it was the only way to graduate. I have never been treated with such disrespect in my life.

Very smart, humerous and helpful, just ask questions!  It's a difficult class, so be prepared to do all of his homework and then some if you want an A.  His tests are pretty tough, but he gives practice tests before hand that are very similar.  Be prepared to go to all classes or you'll fall behind.

He is a great professor! If you just go to class and sit up front you can hear his craziness. He tends to mumble but nothing about the work. Usually about students in the class that show up once the whole year. He is very smart and willing to spend one on one time. Grades do not matter to him. If he feels you have learned something he gives you a B

Wasn't helpful at all and you basically have to teach yourself.  If you ask questions he'll tell you what chapter it's in but that's about it.  He also likes to make people look stupid, I'd look elsewhere if you're looking for a teacher that will actually care about the students.

I'm going to get an A so I'm not just mad about my grade.He is very disrespectful and seemingly has nothing planned every class.I would estimate 25% of class is him looking down for what to do next.He acts like he doesn't want to be there,and is not enthusiastic about the material and generally negative.Don't take him unless you have to.

DO NOT TAKE THIS PROFESSOR. I do not understand how he is teaching, or why he keeps getting hired. I have no idea how I got a B in the class, I was totally lost on the final, and if you are lost, don't ask him, he just makes you feel dumb. He makes fun of people, and hates his job. Stay Away.

Everything stated previously is absolutely CORRECT! He is an awful teacher so you will have to teach yourself. His test are too hard, and too long for the time allowed! However, if you do get stuck w/ this professor GO TO CLASS! I completely earned an F and I'm assuming because I attended his class regularly (missed2) he gave me a 'C'

Teaches class as if its independent study - only answers questions students asks and dismisses class when they done asking questions. At same time, often ridicules students for having questions. Only cares about students who show interest in topic.
His class is boring. Although he doesn't check homework, he doesn't explain the work very well. He gives take home tests over thanksgivings break too.

In my experience, my advice for this teacher is STAY AWAY!!!! He makes fun of you in class, I didn't want to ask questions because he is very rude. He makes strange noises in class(Bill Cosby esq). No help in class, and forget him helping you one on one, all he does is make you feel stupid.

STAY AWAY! He's an awful professor. He never comes prepared, he just starts talking about material, assuming we know what he's talking about. "You know what I mean?" is his famous phrase. He makes fun of you if you ask questions. Be ready to teach yourself the material, because he's simply terrible. The book is your friend. His tests are hard too.
Maybe Professor Gilliam was okay for 2100 and 2200. However, Business Statistics is already a difficult class, and he doesnt make it any easier. Dropped this class. He is WAY TOO HARD.
The only good thing about him is that your final replaces all of your grades.
Doesn't do a lot of teaching but very nice.  Easy A if you know your stuff.
EASY A OR HIGH B IF YOU STUDY THE BOOK AND HAVE A LITTLE COMMON SENSE

if you are not a math oriented person STAY AWAY! If he feels your question is stupid, he will respond accordingly. If you are late to class, dont go! Rude in my opinion. I withdrew from his class after 2 weeks because I had picked up his class during drop/add & asked for help to catch up, his reply was handing me the syllabus!

Business stat is a hard class. You have to work some problems from the book outside of class if you want to learn this stuff. He gives 3 exams and 3 review sheets. They are difficult but if you study and do problems until you understand the material, you can get an A (I did). He curves grades heavily. Course is math intensive.

Im taking Econ 2100 and am taking 2200 with Gilliam next semester. I must admit it's a hard class. I dont really get much out of going to class and I end up spending HOURS teaching myself. If you aren't going to put in the study time then dont take this class.

His class was AWFUL! Talks very quietly and is terrible at explaining ANYTHING. Makes random strange noises (only entertainment the entire class) Most test questions come from study guide he gives you class before test... tests were still difficult. Overall... I hated the class. Learned nothing and it was extremely boring.

I absolutely hated this class!! I had to drop it right before the final drop out date. I defanetly put in a good 2months into class. I went to tutoring and studied for hours before test. I still got an F. He talks really fast and assumes you already know the material. Tests are very hard and require ALOT of math. Funny guy but not a good teacher!

Dr. Gilliam is an excellent professor. Do not take class if you are lazy, never come to class, like to be treated like a baby, and can't take people with a sense of humor. I went to all lectures, didn't really study much, paid a lot of attention. At the end of the class needed a 60% in the final to make an A. Gilliam and Goodwin are the best in dep
He is a rather laid back professor, he teaches strange and his tests are rather tricky.  I recommend him if you are pretty good at math and learning the material elsewhere.
Do the homework.  He expects you to put reasonable effort into learning the material.  Don't show up late, and don't whine if you screw up.  He grades on a curve.

Prof Gilliam is a very sarcastic person. He has a tendency to belittle people in class. He explains the material and expects you to get it the first time and when you don't he treats you as if you were stupid. I am a non-traditional and an "A" student and could not deal with his teaching style.

good prof. got an A (total b-c student) funny guy. open book final exam. test are kinda hard, but not nearly as hard/ detailed as the practice ones he gives as study giudes. allows some extra credit. cares about his students. feeds off what his students want/ say. enjoyed class.
